flawed_nl_solution:
For every acre of grass, the farmer can harvest 560/5 = <<560/5=112>>112 bales of hay each month.
This year, the farmer has 7 + 5 = <<7+5=12>>12 acres of grass.
He can expect to harvest 12 x 112 = <<12*112=1344>>1344 bales of hay per month.
The total hay production this year is 1344*12 = <<1344*12=16128>>16128
From September to December, the farmer would have to feed his horses for a total of 30 + 31 + 30 + 31 = <<30+31+30+31=212>>212 days
Each day his horse eats a total of 3*9 = <<3*9=27>>27 bales of hay.
For the 212 days, the horses will eat a total of 27*212 = <<27*212=5724>>5724 bales.
The total number of bales remaining will be 16128-5724 = <<16128-5724=10404>>10404.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 122, not 212. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
